upfront savings aside leasing might be the better deal for electric vehicles and plugin hybrid cars per consumer reports this is a fantastic indepth report on the pros and cons of leasing electric and hybrid vehicles by consumer reports senior autos reporter keith barry he also addresses if you should buy out your ev or hybrid car lease you can read that section here if you would rather skip the article should you buy your ev at the end of a lease that depends almost all lease contracts have whats called a buyout amount or payoff amount a dollar value that you can pay the leasing company to purchase the car outright you can negotiate this number but only before a lease is signed leasing companies hope that it will accurately reflect what a car is worth at the end of a lease but they could get it wrong if demand for used evs is high at the end of your lease resale values may be higher than expected and it may make sense to purchase the car for the buyout value thats written into the lease contract if the automaker underestimates the resale value you can buy the car and have equity or sell it for a profit says fisher thats what many lessees were able to do when usedcar values soared early during the pandemic but if similar cars are selling for less than the buyout amount written into your leaseor if the new crop of evs are better than the leased one youre turning inits smart to walk away

i need help troubleshooting a 2017 kia forte powerstarting issue tldr my 2017 kia forte is not turning over and im hoping someone can point me in the right direction for correctly identifying the issue so i can get it fixed im trying to avoid going down the incorrect path is it the battery the alternator the starter something else thank you hey all 2017 kia forte 95k miles 5 year old battery never been serviced for starter alternator electrical a few days the tpms and triangle with exclamation dash lights appeared and at that same time the car took a few cranks to startit typically fires up immediately when turning the ignition the entire dash flickered with each crank like if the power failed and restarted each time and made a sharp click sound from that moment on this happened every time i started the vehicle and increased in severity it started with a single delayed crank then two then 3 and now what we seehear in the video video was taken yesterday two days ago i removed the battery and hooked it up to my viking charger which said battery health 90 and charge level was at 80 so i let it charge on 2 amps for a few hours before i had to leavecharging ended still on 80 car started up with only a couple of cranksclicks and i was off the next couple of starts were the same but after a couple of hours of being out turning off and starting the issue increased again yesterday morning on the day the video was taken i removed the battery again and put it back on the charger charge was still at 80 so i did a quick charge at 8 amps and it charged to 100 in about an hour put the battery back in the car and a few hours later i tried starting the vehicle and the current state began another weird symptom i attempted to scan using my odbii scanner and i keep getting a link failed after a huge delay on reading kpwm codes it could be the scanner died its old but just wanted to add that here in case it helps with diagnosis since the car wont start i cannot drive it to the parts store to have the alternatorbatterystarter tested and im hoping to avoid removing the alternator or starter unless i absolutely need to i live in apartments where car repair isnt allowed onsite and i will incur a fine for doing so i have a basic understanding of starteralternatorbattery issues and i have replaced all 3 several times on my own vehicles throughout my lifetime any and all ideas or similar experiences are appreciated

a casuals guide to cayo perico solo minimal stress and super easy i keep seeing new players or players whove never done cayo asking for advice and much of the advice they receive is about maximizing profit per hour which i think can be daunting for someone who isnt yet familiar with cayo so i wanted to write up a guide for an easy minimalstress run for newcomers preheist preparation recommended equipmentset up 1 armored vehicle armored kuruma is ideal here but any car with bulletresistant windows will work if you do not havecannot afford one the duke odeath is free to claim from warstock but its not the best in terms of bullet protection 2 flying vehicle if youre brand new to this run other jobs until you can afford the sparrow upgrade for the kosatka if you already have another flying vehicle it wont be as convenient but it will work 3 rebreathers go to ammunation and stock up on rebreathers 4 set spawn point to kosatka gather intel getting the velum when triggering gather intel youll be sent to paleto bay to steal a smuggler plane fast travel your kosatka nearest your destination then use your sparrow if you have it to fly to the marker or beach the kosatka and call in another vehicle do not use explosives just get close and shoot all the bad dudes theres no penalty for dying just get the job done get in the plane and fly it to the waypoint disguise youre automatically wearing a smugglers disguise which grants you access to the airstrip roam around freely nothing bad can happen to you beyond the airstrip however if youre caught youll be sent back to the airstrip you can be caught by visual sight or by making too much noise like with a vehicle engine dont worry well be avoiding this risk mostly secondary loot values refer to this later gold fills 75 of a loot bag for 330k value a full bag of gold will earn you 492k cocaine 1 group of cocaine fills 50 of your bag for 220k in value 440k for a full bag weed 1 group of weed fills 33 of your bag for 150k in value a full bag will earn you 450k cash 1 group of cash fills 25 of your bag for 90k in value a full bag will earn you 360k paintings each painting fills 50 of your bag value floats somewhere between 140k and 200k each secondary loot planning if you want to grab secondary loot youre going to scope 3 locations the hangar the air strip shed and rubios office which you will do when hacking the security cameras if you do not want to grab secondary loot you can still scope for loot in rubios office while hacking the security cameras and if there are paintings inside you can still come away with secondary loot without hardly any additional effort hangar loot start with the hangar go inside peer through the cage on the main level and photograph whatever is on the two tables park the fork lift near the cage and climb onto the roof to see the tables on the second level shed loot the shed is directly across the ramped road from the power station just run inside the shed and snap pics of the two tables rubios office as the main objective you will hack the security cameras to identify the primary target while doing this scan rubios office for paintings unless youve already found more valuable loot at the air strip once you know what loot is available at these 3 locations use the secondary loot value table to decide which loot stashes to hit if youre lucky the hangar will have a full bags worth of valuable loot otherwise youll need to also hit up the shed which only slightly complicates this run but its no big deal scope the primary you have to sneak across the island to the radio tower most guides are going to have to try to jump over a checkpoint with a motorcycle but ill tell you that in my experience its pretty easy to get caught and sent back to the airstrip without the bike yet ive had 100 success just ditching the bike before the checkpoint and running the rest of the way i believe until you get the hang of it its a safer bet to do it my way you can use this route but at the point where he jumps the checkpoint i would park the bike to the right side of the road and run through the gate immediately turning right and just using your minimap to dodge vision cones as you run to the tower at the tower the network panel could be on the ground level or up on the tower somewhere find it hack it and scan through the camera feeds if the loot at the air strip was disappointing find rubios office camera feed and look for paintings if the air strip loot was good just look for the basement camera and scope the primary target once youve scoped the primary exit out of the camera feeds pause the game go to online find new session and youll spawn in your kosatka with the objective completed you do not need to sneak back to the airplane nor do you need to get yourself caught or die to get teleported back skip all of that by starting a new session heist prep prep bearer bonds steal safe code if your primary target is bearer bonds youll be stealing safe codes from a dude at the casino the mission is completed the instant you lose the cops at which point you will switch sessions to teleport to your kosatka at this point fast travel your kosatka back to vespucci beach any other item steal plasma cutter if your primary target is something in the glass case you will need to return the item to your kosatka so before you launch this mission fast travel the kosatka back to vespucci beach if you own a flying vehicle you may leave your kosatka out in the water if you choose or beach it to save some time if you dont own a flying vehicle park your kosatka at the end of the pier and use the pier to drive to the top of the sub so you can jump on easily keep in mind that any vehicle you park on top of the sub may fall into the water so be sure to return it to storage before you enter the sub or beach the sub so that when it falls off it lands on the sand the sparrow parks inside the sub just fly over top and press right on the dpad to land automatically armor and snacks go to weapon loadout and buy the suppressors for 5000 you may not fire a shot but just in case you do its only 5000 for that added insurance skip approach vehicle prep save it for last this isnt super important but itll save you a little time heist prep actual steal safe code if you have this mission go to the casino run the halls until you find two guards standing outside a room quietly take them both down and go inside kill everyone find your target check his body for the safe codes then leave lose the cops mission over this is when you would switch sessions and then fast travel your kosatka back to the beach steal plasma cutter flying vehicle armored car makes this faster travel to first location there are no enemies here just go inside and look for the heist planning board and take a photo of it stand back a bit further than you think you need to before taking the photo go near your second waypoint if youre flying land and call in your armored car if youre driving proceed here all you need to do is drive over the objective item you do not need to exit the vehicle at all just bulldoze your way into the alleyway and collect the item then return to your flying vehicle and fly to your sub or just drive there steal blow torch travel to construction site look for hard hat usually near the entrance if your site is the skyscraper the hardhard is on the top level landing up there with a flying vehicle makes this super easy hard hat gives you a bit of a grace period of being seen before the alert is raised dont linger in vision cones just run around looking for the green marker above a tool box when you find the one that has the blow torch collect it then leave back to your sub steal fingerprint cloner travel to waypoint 1 pavel will warn you about the cameras ignore him it only gives you like a 2 second advantage go inside take cover shoot the 4 guards hack the computer travel to location 2 shoot both cameras by the door go inside run to the back and grab the cloner no enemies in here so breath easy return to sub steal weapons doesnt matter what guns you pick but i pick the loadout with sticky bombs to make it easier to suicide in case i need to restart if you get the merryweather mission either use your guided torpedo to blow up the helicopter at the destination to fail the mission or switch sessions to reroll the mission you want one that tells you to go to a building land on the roof if you can go inside kill everyone inside hack the computer and open the safe if you have a molotov throw it into the office and wait itll clear out most enemies leaving only a few when you go back to the elevator press left on the dpad to return to the roof shoot the gunners out of the helicopters then take off in yours if you approach from the ground you just have more dudes to fight take the guns back to the sub steal the longfin this will be your approach vehicle for the heist either call in your owned phantom wedge or steal one of the trucks pavel marks for you simply back up into the trailer then drive away drive a good distance away then exit the truck find another vehicle and lose the cops alternatively just suicide and when you respawn youll have no wanted level return to the truck and take it to the drop off now change sessions to teleport back to the kosatka this isnt necessary but it saves some time now youre ready to heist heist set up 1 approach vehicle longfin 2 infiltration point main dock important even though we arent going here 3 compound access drainage tunnel 4 escape point air strip or anything doesnt matter 5 time of day day 6 ignore 7 ignore 8 ignore heist 1 it begins with a cut scene of you driving the boat toward the docks hold the brake and hold the handbrake as soon as you can control turn hard left and drive the boat to the corner between the airstrip runway and the electrical station park near the shore but dont beach it you can turn it around now or wait until you return 2 run to the hangar avoiding the guard that patrols it collect whatever loot you decided to take from here using the fork lift to raise a crate so you can jump the fence if you need to go up there if you have all the loot you need from here skip step 3 3 skip this step if you already filled your loot bag otherwise go to the side road between the power station and the shed the guard patroling this road can be killed when hes walking away toward the open field take him out to remove the risk of him spotting you shoot the camera after hes dead inside the power station you can shut down all cameras if you wish but its not necessary 4 while standing on the road look over toward the shed the guard up on the balcony of the far building can see you if youre not careful wise to shoot him and remove that risk shoot the camera looking at the entrance to the shed 5 go inside the shed and take whatever loot you need 6 return to the longfin and drive to the drainage tunnel note that boat patrols are not hostile toward you as long as youre unarmed youre posing as a smuggler they think youre supposed to be there 7 once near the drainage tunnel stop the boat back a ways to make it easier to swim to the marker dive in the water and press left on the dpad to equip a rebreather swim to the grate and cut it open do not stress you will not run out of breath each rebreather lasts a long time and you have 20 of them youre fine swim through the tunnel and accept this as your entry point 8 you exit through a door and youve initiated a checkpoint if you die from here forward you will respawn right here with your previous progress fully intact no stress youll be fine view this map of the route to rubios office 1 spawn point run forward and up the stairs 2 run along this wall the guards wont see you 3 this guard will walk away just make sure hes not coming toward you if he is wait 4 this guard will walk away wait for him to move hell walk into a small alcove where you can pistol whip him if you want but you can also just ignore him 5 this guard is on the top level ignore him for now but eventually youll run up and bonk him as he comes around a corner just keep an eye out and be ready 6 this guard never moves just sneak behind him now you should be in the office at the top floor of this building check the safe in the far corner of the room for some extra cash automatically grabbed then hack the elevator fingerprint hack its easy there are 8 segments of fingerprint and 8 options to choose from find the top of the finger print and put it in 1 then move to the second segment now find the top of the finger print then scroll to the next one thats 2 move to the third segment find the top of the fingerprint then scroll to the 3rd option follow this logic for the remaining segments literally do this for each line and youll nail it every time basement nothing to worry about down here if you are stealing bearer bonds pavel sends you the safe code just put in the correct code and youre done if stealing something from the glass case run the plasma cutter until about 75 heat then let it cool down to about 25 do this repeatedly and youll be through it in no time now head back up the elevator to the office escape the compound view this map of the escape route 1 from the office run all the way back down the stairs pass behind guard 2 i mislabeled he should be the 1 because hes the first you encounter but whatever 2 guard 1 if you did not deal with him on the way in is still walking his usual path just wait for him to walk into the alcove and pass behind him jumping over the railing and turning left to head toward the main gate 3 main gate theres one patrolling guard here just make sure hes walking away as soon as you enter the marker youre safe 4 note the juggernaut is walking around but hes easily avoided using this route just keep an eye and an ear out and make sure hes moving away before you hit the ground level escape cayo perico view this map of the final escape 1 turn left and run to the very tip of this bit of the island that juts out avoid vision cones theres only two that you may need to worry about but theyre easily avoided 2 when you reach the edge just walk down it dont jump dont try to combat roll just walk you might fall but you wont suffer serious injury 3 get in the water and dive under press left on the dpad to equip a rebreather then swim as low to the ground as you can rubio will come out in his helicopter no matter what it does not mean that you did something wrong but if youre low enough he wont spot you 4 swim this direction as soon as you see the whale bones swim to them and the mission will end elite challenges 1 complete in under 15 minutes this run with a little practice can be done in under 13 minutes with no sweat including the additional stop at the air strip shed i got hung up trying to swim to the drainage tunnel and still managed a 1236 on my last effort and that was without rushing 2 do not get spotted if you follow this guide you wont 3 fill your bag if you follow the loot table and recommendations youll have a full bag 4 dont fail the hack you wont fail it if you understand how it works follow my advice and this hack is impossible to fail 5 do not restart this is the one that might cost you the elite challenge until youve practiced it a bit after a few tries youll have it worked out well enough that you can run this without needing to restart final advicenotes take your time there is no rush here at all each and every one of these steps can be taken at your own pace so just slow down and breathe this guide is meant to give you an easy run to get used to cayo perico this is not the most efficient best paying or fastest run possible use this run to build off of and experiment it teaches you the basics to help you understand the mechanics of the heist which lowers the overall difficulty immensely good luck and have fun

2016 corvette c7 vs 2018 bmw m2 hey yall wondering what might be the best option for me out of these two choices the 2016 c7 has 55k miles and is asking 35k and the 2018 m2 has 39k miles and is asking 41k i had a m240i and an audi s7 v8 before and thoroughly enjoyed the m240i more just because of how much more nimble it was on the road and the instant throttle response ive been driving an electric for awhile after i last sold the s7 but i think its time to get back into a gas guzzling machine reliability and maintenance is important for me since i hated the s7 maintenance costs i live in a warm climate pretty much all year long so i dont mind rwd ive had and been a fan of bmws since i was young but also wondering what a pure american v8 might feel like i do like having some road presence still want decent mpg i know its not gonna be a honda and do not require too much truck space just me my wife and our small dog im looking to do quite a few roadtrips with this vehicle as my wife and i have a plan to drive through the west coast pch next year so something thats good on the highway comfortable and easy to get around town is also important any suggestions would be appreciated thank you

is a portable cooler suitable for car journeys hey everyone so ive been doing a lot of road trips lately and one thing thats been bugging me is keeping drinks and snacks cold without stopping every few hours at gas stations i started looking into portable coolers for my car and honestly theyve been a game changer why i think theyre perfect for road trips first off let me just say that having a portable cooler in your vehicle is way more convenient than those oldschool ice chests no more dealing with melting ice or soggy sandwiches most electric coolers nowadays plug right into your cars 12v outlet which means they keep running while you drive i used to pack regular coolers with tons of ice but by hour three of my trip everything would be sitting in water not fun when youre trying to grab a cold drink or some cheese for the kids what makes them work in cars the main thing is that modern portable cooling units are designed specifically for travel theyre compact enough to fit in your backseat or trunk without taking up the entire space plus they actually maintain consistent temperature which is something traditional coolers cant do once that ice starts melting i found some really solid options when i was shopping around if youre interested id recommend checking out these portable coolers that work great for automotive use theyve got different sizes depending on how much storage space you need my experience using one ive been using mine for about four months now on weekend getaways and longer drives the biggest benefit i can keep medications cool important for my mom who rides with us store fresh food for camping and always have cold water available no more paying crazy prices at rest stops the power consumption is pretty minimal too i was worried it would drain my battery but as long as your engine is running youre totally fine some models even have battery protection features that prevent them from killing your car battery when parked things to consider not all portable coolers are created equal though you want something with good insulation and reliable cooling performance also check the capacity because some are pretty small and might not fit everything you need for a family trip sound insulation matters too some cheaper models can be noisy which gets annoying on long drives read reviews before buying anything bottom line if you do regular car journeys whether its commuting road trips or camping adventures a portable cooler is definitely worth it it pays for itself pretty quickly when you stop buying overpriced cold drinks and food on the road for anyone interested in grabbing one you can browse different models and sizes right here theyve got options for different budgets and needs hope this helps anyone whos been on the fence barricades that replicate the exact dimensions and layout of the proposed tunnels entry and exit ramps as per the dpr by hiring vehicles to move through these temporary ramps during peak hours traffic behaviour and merging challenges can be directly observed and recorded digital simulation using computerbased traffic modelling and 3d animation the proposed tunnel and ramps can be recreated to scale including road geometry lane widths and real traffic volumes such digital simulations can test different scenarios peak hours weekend traffic or emergencies providing clear evidence of whether the tunnel truly reduces congestion state government can do small investment to develop this kind of app to verify the outcome why simulation matters evidence from existing infrastructure shows that adding tunnels or flyovers often shifts congestion rather than solving it reduced surface lanes tunnel ramps typically occupy existing road space reducing the number of surface lanes unless additional beijings new export system tightens the grip on us defense supply chains original article chinas new validated enduser system signals a tactical loosening for ev and tech manufacturers and a tightening chokehold on us defense supply chains in a geopolitical chess move thats as strategic as it is sly china is devising a new export control system for rareearth magnets and related materials designed to loosen the spigot for civilian companies while firmly shutting it off for those linked to the us military this validated enduser framework as beijing calls it promises faster approvals for nondefense firms potentially smoothing supply chains for everything from electric vehicles to consumer electronics but for pentagon contractors consider it a polite no entry sign ensuring critical minerals dont fuel american weaponry amid escalating trade tensions the plan first revealed by the wall street journal comes as no surprise in the ongoing uschina tech tussle china has long held the reins on the global rareearth market commanding around 6070 of mining output and over 85 of refining and magnet production since the 1990s these elements are the unsung heroes behind hightech wonders like fighter jets missiles drones wind turbines and ai hardware the us heavily reliant on these imports has been scrambling to build alternatives with the department of war mandating a phaseout of chinasourced rareearth magnets in defense systems by 2027 yet experts warn that ramping up domestic or allied supplies could take five to ten years leaving american industries vulnerable in the interim beijings latest tweak builds on a series of escalating restrictions throughout 2025 back in april china halted exports of key rareearth minerals vital for cars semiconductors and aerospace leaving us firms with scant stockpiles due to lean inventory practices by midsummer bans targeted magnets for advanced us weaponry dubbed supply chain deterrence by analysts then in october controls tightened further barring reexports of products with even trace amounts01of chinese rareearth materials without approval granting beijing effective veto power over global flows this has been labeled tech decapitation in some circles a direct retort to us curbs on semiconductor exports and advanced manufacturing tech under the proposed validated enduser system chinese authorities would expedite licenses for vetted civilian buyers fulfilling a pledge from leader xi jinping to president trump to ease material flows without compromising national security concerns its a nuanced pivot promote trade in peaceful sectors while hobbling military advancements potentially easing strains in nondefense areas like evs and renewables however the ripple effects could be profound over 78 of us weapons systems depend on chinesesourced materials so delays in production for assets like f35 jets or aienabled tech are a real risk domestic players like mp materials nyse mp americas sole major rareearth miner stand to gain though full selfsufficiency remains a distant goal globally this could jolt allies such as the eu and japan whose exports to the us might snag on chinese material origins economically it spells volatility for tech and defense stocks with upside potential for alternative miners geopolitically its beijings micdrop in the trade war leveraging its mineral monopoly much like the us wields chip dominanceframed by some as a push for peace by curbing arms production

how the us overtook china as africas biggest foreign investor bbc the african continent is rich in critical minerals and metals like lithium rare earths cobalt and tungsten which are vital to making and running our personal tech such materials are also essential for everything from electric vehicles to ai data centres and weapon systems china has long been the biggest player in the global market for critical minerals and metals it has significant reserves at home and access to supplies from overseas thanks to major investment in foreign mining operations particularly in africa beijing has also built up a dominant position when it comes to processing global supplies and it has rattled the us with the threat of curbing exports thats lent added urgency to us moves to increase its access to critical minerals and metals with african reserves seen as key to that mission this is so much the case that the us has actually quietly overtaken china as the biggest foreign direct investor in africa according to the latest annual figures the us invested 78bn 6bn across africa in 2023 compared with 4bn by china according to the china africa research initiative of johns hopkins university which accessed official data it marks the first time since 2012 that the us had regained the lead this american investment is being led by a government agency called the us international development finance corporation dfc this was set up in 2019 during president trumps first term of office and it is not shy about saying that its mission is to take on beijing the dfc says on its website that it was established as a means of countering chinas presence in strategic regions

the car wars the chinese transformed themselves into an industrial powerhouse after deng xiaopings reforms lifted an agrarian nation into the industrial age following chinas accession to the world trade organization in 2001 beijings ambition to become the worlds factory was realized but one frontier remained impervious to chinese mastery automobiles for decades that domain belonged to germany japan and the united states which perfected the art of building cars through a century of engineering evolution a technological opening then came electrification the shift to electric vehicles evs has transformed the automobile from a combustion marvel into a software and batterydriven machine that is simpler lighter and more modular the sophisticated expertise that had protected legacy automakers for 100 years was suddenly obsolete the ev revolution neutralized the very complexity that defined western dominance for china this was more than an industrial opportunity it was a strategic destiny beijing saw evs as a convergence of manufacturing scale energy security and geopolitical control the ccp didnt just want to participate in the green transition it sought to own it electric cars were easier to make batteries were easier to scale and crucially china controlled the minerals they relied on the industrial chessboard was reset economics of scale or scale without economics from an economic lens this shift is staggering chinas automotive export machine expanded from under one million cars in 2018 to over 55 million by 2024 making it the worlds largest exporter in 2025 alone a record 3 million vehicles were exported in the first half of the year driven largely by new energy vehicles nevs and hybrids chinese carmakers now command nearly 40 of all global ev exports and four out of every ten electric cars shipped worldwide are made in china yet this triumph hides deep financial strain overcapacity and price wars plague the domestic market the nation can build 55 million vehicles a year but sells barely half profit margins for most automakers hover around 4 compared to over 10 in north america titans like byd and geely face shrinking returns even byds 2025 secondquarter profits fell by nearly 30 as prices plunged chinas automotive expansion is not driven by market economics its driven by industrial momentum and political design finance and the model of state capitalism this distortion is rooted in finance since 2009 beijing has poured over 230 billion into subsidies tax breaks and direct funding for ev and battery industries local governments complement this with cheap land zerointerest loans and grants for rd these are not investments for profitability they are strategic instruments in a national campaign the chinese communist party unconcerned by corporate losses demands market share not profit margins the logic is clear dominate now balance sheets later the result is a distorted financial ecosystem where capacity grows faster than consumption prices race to the bottom and debtfinanced competition fuels selfcannibalization but this subsidized scaling has global spillovers it compresses global ev prices and depresses margins for competitors european and american firms must operate under market discipline shareholder returns regulatory scrutiny and labour constraints while chinese firms operate under state cushioning the outcome isnt fair competition its industrial asymmetry taking refuge under free market and globalization principles the chinese dont play by the rules of the west they go through to make their own geopolitics beijings chessboard the car war isnt just commercial its geopolitical for beijing automotive dominance is energy diplomacy wrapped in industrial strategy electric vehicles sever oil dependence insulating china from maritime chokepoints like the strait of malacca while doubling its global economic leverage through battery exports and rare earth control chinas command of the ev supply chain is unmatched it refines 70 of global lithium processes 85 of rare earths and produces threequarters of the worlds ev batteries this is not free market happenstance but the outcome of two decades of strategic planning through policies like made in china 2025 and the 14th fiveyear industrial plan in contrast europe finds itself trapped between regulatory ideals and industrial vulnerability germanys auto industry the jewel of postwar capitalism is faltering volkswagens sales in china are declining as domestic chinese brands leap ahead on battery range software and affordability mercedes and bmw face tariff barriers abroad and market shrinkage at home while saicowned mg sells more evs across europe than most native brands the german economic miracle that once powered the eu is now being undercut by chinese overcapacity and precision western capitalism in the shape of automotive giants is stopping the eu from taking preventive actions policy paralysis beijings biggest strength supply chains the great reshaping no discussion of the car wars can ignore the supply chain revolution that made them possible china rebuilt the automotive supply chain into a vertically integrated empire from raw minerals to finished vehicles firms like catl and byd exemplify this integration producing batteries semiconductors electronics and vehicles under one roof this compression slashes costs improves operating margins and ensures logistical sovereignty legacy western manufacturers stretched globally over decades creating fragile supply chains spanning continents the pandemic shattered those illusions meanwhile china used the crisis as a consolidation moment reshoring components securing longterm mineral contracts in africa and south america and investing through its belt and road initiative bri through bri china built rail corridors in central asia and ports in africa that now carry not coal or grain but cars china is also eyeing the emerging northern sea corridor rendered navigable by global warming and envisioned by russia as a future trade artery to shorten routes to europe cut transit costs and improve operating margins across whatever flows through its industrial engine chinas export offensive was logistical as much as industrial ports like shanghai and guangzhou were redesigned for roro rollonrolloff vehicle exports byd now operates its own carrier fleet of oceangoing vessels capable of hauling thousands of cars across continents bypassing western logistics chokepoints this selfreliance secures the arteries of global automotive trade the bri also multiplied trade corridors turning inland manufacturing hubs like chongqing into automotive gateways to europe via rail in regions like the middle east and latin america chinese automakers replicate this model exporting not just cars but entire supply ecosystems from dealerships to charging grids germanys automakers once relied on supply efficiency and brand prestige now they face a player with both the means of production and distribution hardwired into national policy policy and governance commanding an industry the governance of chinas automotive rise reflects the countrys hybrid political economy centralized coordination with market discipline at the periphery chinas ministry of industry and information technology acts less as a regulator and more as a national commander the state decides which enterprises merge which technologies survive and which components receive export licenses in 2025 beijing introduced export licensing for evs ostensibly to manage quality but effectively to control global supply and pricing dynamics meanwhile new nev production regulations restrict license issuance aiming to rein in disorderly competition these moves blend macroeconomic management with strategic foresight the west governed by fragmented markets and legalistic oversight has no equivalent machinery indeed what europe and the us now face is industrial policy as foreign policy business and market dynamics in business terms chinas automakers behave less like competitors and more like soldiers in a single campaign byd geely chery and saic exploit different geographies and price segments under a coordinated national strategy the result is a globally synchronized offensive byd targets emerging markets like brazil thailand and south africa with locally assembled evs priced below 20000 geely and mg on the other hand attack midtier european markets with sleek designs and aggressive financing and warranty options the collective aim is to flood every price point simultaneously as i say profit is not the goal saturation is legacy automakers bound by quarterly earnings and esg boards simply cannot match this tempo their capital discipline once an advantage now acts like a brake against statebacked relentlessness remember the volkswagen diesel gate scandal the engineers at vw found it easier to fudge the emissions levels amidst the growing pressure of stricter emissions regulations and lofty state climate pledges and economic realities to deal with investor expectations at every earnings call all the while when beijing was focused on building ree rare earth elements capacity overlooking the environmental hazards finance and global markets internationally chinas autofinancial complex is rewiring global capital flows the countrys automakers raise cheap credit from state banks tap domestic bonds and even issue green bonds under climate initiatives branding themselves as the financial face of sustainable mobility meanwhile western oems struggle with capitalintensive transitions squeezed between investor demands and soaring ev rd costs global investors face a paradox chinas auto sector offers scale and growth but not transparency or profits yet multinational funds still pour in betting on state guarantees and industrial longevity thus financial globalization becomes the enabler of this very asymmetry the green transition and strategic overlap ironically the wests green transition a cornerstone of its climate agenda has deepened its dependence on china europes emission goals battery regulations and subsidy schemes incentivize ev adoption but inadvertently accelerate chinese dominance in the supply chain in 2025 roughly half the evs sold in the eu had madeinchina labelled batteries chinas government shrewdly casts this as global climate leadership massive ev deployment aligns with carbon neutrality pledges while cementing export power the result is a geopolitical inversion green transition policies in brussels and washington now fuel economic leverage in beijing environmental concerns thus converge with industrial ambition china is leveraging decarbonization for economic weaponization the strategic reckoning western policymakers now face a brutal dilemma protect the green transition or protect the domestic industry tariffs production subsidies and localization mandates are bandaids against an industrial earthquake germany has quietly supported eu tariffs even as its carmakers plead for exemptions in china but to deal with this what the old continent lacks is policy unity meanwhile the united states under president trumps revived trade nationalism enforces 100 tariffs on chinese evs and 60 on chinese goods overall yet even with america largely closed the scale of chinese overproduction guarantees global fallout supply will flow somewhere and flood prices everywhere the inevitable fallout what happens when overcapacity meets decarbonization finance meets politics and globalization devolves into industrial warfare the world gets what i call the car wars a battle not for profit but for survival for china its a managed war of attrition meant to consolidate global mobility supply chains under its industrial order for the west it is economic containment under the guise of climate ethics the wests choice is stark follow chinas model of industrial statecraft with democratic transparency or brace for longterm deindustrialization in cars the crown jewel of 20thcentury capitalism and a symbol of postwar prosperity especially in the us as chinese ships laden with electric sedans glide from ningbo to rotterdam the message is clear the age of the automotive west has given way to the era of the industrial east economics finance business policy and climate are no longer separate spheres they are fronts in a single global conflict fought over mobility power and the control of the green future the ccp doesnt believe in a consumptionled economy industrial might or exportled growth as a playbook which has brought it to stiff domestic competition and industrial overcapacity how china deals with its overcapacity will decide where the economic and geopolitical realities of the world will be headed if you like what you read hop on to the link below to my substack

michael burrys bytesized warning to the ai bulls original article as nvidias trilliondollar ai empire expands michael burry the man who called the 2008 crash warns that big techs obsession with shortlived chips and creative accounting could turn the ai boom into the next financial bubble the world has seen its share of speculative frenzies from the dotcom boom to the crypto craze investors have always been drawn to the promise of endless growth now artificial intelligence has become the latest obsession and nvidia corp nasdaq nvda stands at its epicenter its powerful chips are the foundation of modern ai driving record profits stock rallies and trilliondollar valuations yet amid the euphoria one seasoned skeptic is once again raising a red flag michael burry the man who famously predicted the 2008 financial crisis believes the math behind the ai boom doesnt add up the warning cuts to the core of the ai economy depreciation the chips powering this revolution have short lives falling in value fast as new models roll out the result a system that depends on perpetual reinvestment and creative accounting to look sustainable the short life of ais golden machines every revolution needs its tools and for ai those tools are nvidias gpusgraphicsprocessing units capable of handling the colossal calculations behind models like chatgpt each one costs tens of thousands of dollars and together they make up a huge portion of the roughly 400 billion that the worlds largest technology companies plan to spend on ai infrastructure this year analysts expect that figure to swell to nearly 3 trillion by 2029 but unlike factories or fiberoptic networks these chips dont last their typical lifespan is around five years after which they become technologically obsolete nvidias chief executive officer jensen huang halfjoked earlier this year that once its nextgeneration blackwell chips start shipping you couldnt give hoppers away that may have been said in jest but it highlights a serious truthai hardware loses value almost as quickly as smartphones this short shelf life is forcing the biggest hyperscalers amazon nasdaq amzn microsoft nasdaq msft and alphabet inc nasdaq googl into a spending cycle that never ends to stay competitive they must constantly refresh their data centers with the latest silicon what was once a oneoff investment has become a treadmill of recurring costs and the financial implications are staggering michael burrys growing concern burry isnt disputing ais potential hes questioning its economics his argument centers on the depreciation schedules these companies are using to justify their massive capital spending by stretching the useful life of their servers from four years to six or even seven companies make their profits appear higherbecause theyre spreading out the cost of their hardware over more years meta platforms inc nasdaq meta for example boosted its net income by nearly 2 billion in the first nine months of 2025 by extending the assumed lifespan of its servers meanwhile amazon nasdaq amzn quietly reversed course this year cutting its estimate back to five years after acknowledging an increased pace of technology development that subtle move signaled what burry has been warning the hardware is aging faster than anyone wants to admit he calls it a depreciation tsunami as each new generation of chips arrives the value of the last one plummets what looks like smart investment today could become a costly burden tomorrow especially for firms that rely heavily on debt to finance their expansion the dangerous world of ai debt the ai boom isnt just being fueled by corporate cash its increasingly powered by borrowed money privatecredit giants like blackstone inc nyse bx magnetar capital and macquarie group ltd asx mqg are providing loans backed by ai hardware some of these loans use nvidia gpus as collaterala striking parallel to the mortgagebacked securities that underpinned the housing bubble before 2008 even nvidia itself is reportedly exploring structured financing models including specialpurpose vehicles designed to buy and lease gpus to major customers like openai coreweave inc and xai the artificialintelligence startup founded by elon musk coreweave nasdaq crwv in particular epitomizes the risks of this new aifinance frontier once a small cloudcomputing startup it now sports a valuation north of 50 billion and a debt load approaching 17 billion including lease liabilities the company is using that money to fund as much as 14 billion in capital expenditures this yearan amount that rivals the annual spending of oil giants like shell plc lse shel coreweave insists its business model is sustainable thanks to longterm contracts with investmentgrade clients but if gpu values fall faster than expectedor if ai demand weakensthose contracts could unravel quickly for burry and others the warning signs are familiar massive leverage rapid depreciation and an unshakeable belief that the future will always be profitable when the hype meets hard reality the entire ai economy hinges on one assumption that demand for computing power will continue to rise indefinitely as long as companies believe that the spending continues the borrowing expands and nvidias share price keeps soaring yet the underlying assets are decaying fast rental prices for nvidias oncecoveted a100 ampere and hopper chips have plunged down 30 or more this year according to industry trackers meanwhile electricity constraints and datacenter bottlenecks are adding new costs that could make older hardware uneconomical to operate nvidias success depends on constant innovation but that same innovation accelerates obsolescence its a paradox that even its ceo acknowledges the faster the chips improve the faster the value of existing infrastructure collapses investors may take comfort in the profits of today but burrys warning suggests that tomorrows balance sheets could tell a harsher story the ai revolution is realbut so are the costs hiding beneath its glossy surface conclusion the ai era has ushered in a new industrial revolution powered by silicon instead of steel nvidias brilliance big techs ambition and wall streets appetite have created a trilliondollar machine that seems unstoppable but as michael burry reminds us even the most dazzling technologies obey the laws of economics depreciation doesnt care about hype hardware ages margins shrink and optimism fades the question isnt whether ai will transform the world it already has the question is whether investors will recognize the risks before the next great bubble bursts

best bang for buck lease offers for november 2025 how i calculate lease deals to make it a fair comparison when manufacturers promote lease offers there is no rule that limits how they can structure the deal many will advertise low monthly payments but require a large down payment in essence there is nothing stopping a manufacturer from advertising 1 monthly payment but requiring a large down payment small print in the disclaimer car shoppers will see low monthly payments but not realize its actually not a good lease deal because the down payment is so large the other thing manufacturers sometimes do is structure the lease deals with much lower annual mileage allowances like 5000 or 7500 miles per year while most lease offers include 12000 miles you have to pay more to get more miles it usually costs about 1012 cents per mile therefore i always recalculate all lease deals with 0 down payment 12k miles per year 10k for luxury vehicles lease acquisition fee included so you can compare these monthly payments apples to apples across all models taxes and dealer fees are not included because these can differ from city to city these deals require excellent credit usually 720 minimum with some exceptions down to 700 if you dont have good credit but are absolutely sure you can make the monthly payments find a cosigner who has good credit they will be on the hook if you cant pay so dont do this unless you are sure you can handle the payments what is bang for buck it shows how much vehicle msrp value you get for each dollar you spend on the monthly payment it is a simple calculation msrp divided by the monthly payment calculated with 0 down payment the average across all lease deals nationwide is about 78 the higher the better anything over 100 is generally an exceptional lease deal what does required mean some lease deals require special rebates to qualify for the offer loyalty this means you must currently own or lease the same brand of vehicle to qualify for the offer conquest this means you must currently own or lease a competing brand of vehicle to qualify employee this means you must be an employee or live in a household with an employee of the manufacturer

a fix for frost engineers use electricity to zap ice without heat or chemicals every sheet of frost contains ionic defects the viginia tech team uses high voltage to polarize these ions rip off the frost virginia tech researchers have developed electrostatic defrosting edf an energyefficient and environmentally friendly deicing method that uses an electric field to dislodge frost by manipulating the natural electrical charges within ice crystals this technique uses an overhead electrode to create an electric field causing negative ions to be attracted upward and positive ions to be repelled downward thereby breaking the ices bond with the surface without using heat or chemicals the team led by associate professor jonathan boreyko published its findings in the journal small methods with potential applications for aircraft vehicles and other equipment mechanism as frost forms it develops natural positive and negative charges due to imperfections in its crystal structure application edf applies a high voltage to an electrode placed above the frost result the resulting electric field forces the charged ions in the ice to move which breaks the frosts grip on the surface advantages this method is more energyefficient than traditional heating methods and avoids the environmental impact of chemical deicers potential applications the researchers hope to eventually make this technology accessible for consumer use such as on car windshields study findings

the diamond wheezers britains greatest heist by grandpas the vault easter weekend 2015 hatton garden london someone is drilling through a concrete wall the sound echoes in the darkness this is the heart of londons diamond district and the drill bit is chewing through 50 centimetres of reinforced concrete leading directly into a vault containing hundreds of safe deposit boxes filled with millions in jewels gold and cash the man operating the hilti dd 350 industrial drill is 67 years old hes diabetic he has heart problems kidney disease he brought his medications with him because this job will take two nights and he cant miss a dose his name is terry perkins and hes already served 22 years in prison for robbing 6 million in the 1983 security express raid now hes back for one last score behind him three other men watch and wait their combined age is 448 years the youngest is 61 the oldest is 76 theyre using free bus passes to travel across london they look like somebodys grandfathers and theyre about to pull off the largest burglary in english legal history three years earlier january 2012 islington north london brian reader sits in the castle pub nursing a pint hes 73 years old supposedly retired living comfortably in dartford with his free pensioners bus pass but retirement doesnt suit him it never has reader isnt an ordinary pensioner in 1983 he was involved in the brinksmat robbery at heathrow airport 26 million in gold and diamonds still britains largest gold heist he served nine years for handling the stolen bullion he was also implicated in the murder of detective constable john fordham during the investigation though he was acquitted on selfdefence grounds now decades later reader is planning again hes been researching watching calculating for three years he will meticulously plot what the press will later call one last dream job he meets with old friends at the castle daniel jones 58 career criminal who was arrested in 2010 for raiding bond street jewellers terry perkins 64 fresh from his security express sentence john kenny collins 72 experienced in breakins despite his age they drink they talk they remember past scores and slowly carefully reader begins to outline his plan the target is hatton garden safe deposit company a vault in the heart of londons diamond district hundreds of boxes belonging to jewellers dealers and people who dont trust banks no one knows exactly whats inside those boxes which makes them irresistible the take could be 14 million maybe 29 million possibly more one of them will later say lets show the digital generation what the old school can do the mystery man but readers crew has a problem theyre oldschool criminals they know how to pick locks disable mechanical alarms avoid physical surveillance but modern security systems are different digital computercontrolled they need someone with technical expertise someone introduces them to a man known only as basil basil is tall and lanky with distinctive reddish hair he appears to have intimate knowledge of security systems he knows door codes he has a key to the front entrance of the hatton garden building he understands how to disable the alarm system in ways that even police will struggle to explain later daniel jones will later write from prison basil was the brains he let me in on the night of the burglary he hid keys and codes throughout the building i saw basil about four times throughout he came and went i dont know anything about him where he lives i wasnt interested jones also claims something explosive basil was a former police officer who got into security work but no one knows who basil really is not even his coconspirators he wears a cap at all times carries a bin bag on his shoulder to obscure his face from cameras wears no distinctive clothing moves with calculated precision for three years after the heist basil will remain a complete phantom good friday 2015 april 3 2015 917 pm a white van pulls up outside 8890 hatton garden its good friday the start of the easter long weekend the building is closed the streets are quiet the timing is perfect basil uses his key to open the front door the alarm doesnt sound hes already disabled it somehow the gang enters reader perkins jones and one other collins at 75 stays outside as the lookout they take the elevator down to the basement then they climb down the lift shaft to access the vault level this part requires physical strength and agility that men in their seventies shouldnt possess but somehow they manage the vault door itself is impenetrable but the gang has studied the buildings blueprints adjacent to the vault is a storage room the wall between the storage room and the vault is concrete but its thinner than the vault door this is their entry point perkins sets up the hilti dd 350 drill the drill bit is 10 centimetres in diameter the wall is 50 centimetres thick this will take hours he begins drilling the sound is enormous but its good friday night the building is empty no one hears 1221 am april 4 2015 an intruder alarm triggers the signal goes to southern monitoring a private security company the call is graded no police response required a catastrophic misjudgement that will later become a scandal a security guard is dispatched instead the guard arrives at the building later that morning he looks through the front door sees nothing obviously wrong the gang has been careful he doesnt enter the building he leaves inside the vault the gang continues working unaware of how close they came to being caught by saturday morning theyve drilled through the wall but now they hit a problem the hole isnt quite wide enough they need to drill more and theyre exhausted theyre old men and theyve been working all night brian reader the mastermind makes a decision he says something that will later be documented in court testimony anything we do from this point on were making it up and thats where mistakes are made reader wants to leave take what they can and go but the others want more theyve come this far why stop now reader feeling unwell leaves the others stay they widen the hole finally its large enough for a man to squeeze through they enter the vault rows and rows of safe deposit boxes line the walls hundreds of them the gang doesnt know which boxes contain the most valuable items so they start breaking them open systematically using crowbars drills and brute force they fill bags with jewels gold ingots cash watches precious stones more than they can carry they work through saturday night and into sunday morning by the time they leave theyve ransacked 73 boxes when they finally climb back up the lift shaft load the bags into the white van and drive away theyve stolen anywhere from 14 million to 200 million depending on whose estimate you believe its the largest burglary in english legal history and they got away clean the digital detectives april 7 2015 tuesday morning businesses return after the long weekend someone opens the vault door at hatton garden safe deposit the scene is chaos broken boxes scattered papers tools left behind a massive hole in the wall police are called immediately flying squad detectives arrive they begin documenting the crime scene collecting evidence reviewing cctv footage and immediately they notice something strange about these criminals detective peter spindler head of specialist crime investigations will later summarize it perfectly they were analogue criminals operating in a digital world they lacked the knowledge to defeat digital detectives the gang had been extraordinarily careful during the heist itself but theyd made critical mistakes in the planning phase the mercedes for reconnaissance and surveillance in the weeks before the heist the gang used a distinctive white mercedes e200 with a black roof and alloy wheels this vehicle was photographed repeatedly on hatton gardens streets by cctv cameras the license plate led directly to john kenny collins age 75 one vehicle one license plate the entire conspiracy begins to unravel the mobile phones for three years during planning the gang had used their own mobile phones to communicate and coordinate every call created records every text message was logged cell tower data showed their locations detectives traced collinss calls to other gang members the records revealed not just who was communicating with whom but also where calls were made from the data corroborated conspiracy showing the men meeting repeatedly at the castle pub and other locations for the actual heist theyd used walkietalkies to avoid creating call records but by then it was too late the planning phase communications had already mapped the entire network the bugs once investigators identified the core suspects they obtained authorization to install listening devices in their vehicles they bugged the mercedes and terry perkinss car what they recorded was devastating the gang members spoke carelessly boasting about the heist discussing their shares of the loot making incriminating admissions in one conversation on may 15 collins said the cash robbery history at time and now the biggest tom the fucking that what they and a book could write fucking hell they were proud of what theyd done and they couldnt resist talking about it may 19 2015 1000 am two hundred police officers in riot gear simultaneously raid 12 addresses across london and kent the timing is crucial strike everyone at once so no one can warn the others or destroy evidence at one address officers recover approximately 43 million in stolen goods hidden in black bags about onethird of the total take daniel jones had hidden his share under a memorial stone in edmonton cemetery two bags of jewels buried in a graveyard the physical evidence combined with communication records bugging transcripts and cctv footage provides an overwhelming prosecution case by the end of may most of the gang is in custody except basil the ghost for three years basil remains free police know he exists hes on surveillance footage tall and lanky with reddish hair always carrying a bin bag to obscure his face but they dont know who he is the red hair is probably a wig he wears no distinctive clothing leaves no fingerprints makes no mistakes was he a former security guard whod worked at hatton garden a former police officer as jones claimed a customer whod been given a tour of the vault an international criminal operative hired specifically for his technical expertise the mystery of how he disabled the alarm system remains partially unexplained the alarm triggered briefly during the operation but basil somehow prevented a full breach the specific methodology is never fully clarified for three years basil is a ghost march 27 2018 600 am early morning raid on a flat in liverpool road islington just two miles from hatton garden police find michael john seed age 58 sitting on a treasure trove over 143000 in gold ingots gems and jewellery scattered around his bedroom evidence that hes been systematically melting down gold and breaking up jewellery on his bedroom workbench bit by bit preparing to sell it through black market contacts michael seed is basil at trial seed denies everything he claims he might have been on a family holiday in cornwall or visiting his elderly mother in cambridge during the heist he denies taking 80000 to 90000 in cash to portugal he claims to be running a legitimate jewellery business but prosecutors note hes filed no tax returns produced no invoices no receipts no bank transfers and cannot name a single customer in march 2019 a jury convicts seed by a 102 majority vote on conspiracy to burgle and unanimously on conspiracy to handle stolen goods hes sentenced to 10 years in prison judge christopher kinch declares your role was a central one you were at the heart of the core activities that had to be carried out you were not just there to fetch and carry in my judgment this must rank among the worst offences of its type seed is ordered to pay back 599768493 within three months or face an additional seven years in jail he cannot pay the money is gone why did they do it this is the question that makes this case so different these werent desperate young men needing quick cash they were pensioners some were comfortable reader had a substantial house in dartford theyd survived decades of criminal activity they could have retired peacefully so why risk everything for one last score professor david wilson from birmingham city university explains you can almost picture the joy and excitement that planning would bring i imagine the more they spoke about it the more excited they became this was the one last dream job there is a great deal of excitement in committing this kind of crime there is a great deal of status attached to it for men whod spent their entire lives some from childhood in the criminal underworld retirement was unbearable criminality wasnt just a job it was their identity the thrill of planning the risktaking the respect from peers in the criminal fraternity were intoxicating in ways legitimate retirement could never provide freddie foreman a criminal kingpin now 83 was asked if he would have joined them his answer reveals the compulsion if theyd asked me to join them i might have found it hard to say no even though my legs arent what they used to be its the excitement the respect you get and its the thought of doing one last job one last job one final legendary score to cement their legacy generational pride proof that oldschool criminal methodology street smarts and patience could still out maneuver modern security systems they were wrong of course modern digital forensics destroyed them but the compulsion was irresistible the mysteries that remain the missing millions only 43 million was recovered the heist was valued anywhere from 14 million to 200 million depending on estimates that means between 9 million and 195 million in stolen goods remains missing where is it some was melted down by seed over three years some was sold on international black markets but much of it has simply vanished with brian readers death in september 2023 kept secret by his family for months the secrets of where the remaining millions are hidden quite possibly died with him the holborn fire on april 1 2015 just hours before the heist began a major electrical fire erupted in holborns kingsway the fire caused an enormous power outage closing major roads and businesses across central london for days john oconnor former head of scotland yards flying squad publicly suggested the fire might have been deliberately set as part of the heist planning i think that probably was deliberate ive never heard of an outage of electricity like that causing a fire that lasted as long as that that seems to me too much of a coincidence his theory the fire was meant to create chaos distract police and emergency services and potentially disable security systems in the area no evidence has ever emerged linking the gang to the fire it remains officially classified as an accident but the timing is striking the inside job question could this heist have been executed without inside help a security guard with over 20 years of experience testified that the level of knowledge required knowing exactly where cameras were which alarm codes would disable the system how to access the lift shaft without triggering secondary alarms strongly suggested inside information police investigated current and former employees of all companies in the building but found no conclusive evidence but the question is did basil have an inside contact had he previously worked there was someone feeding him information the alarm that triggered during the operation but didnt result in police response suggests either extraordinary luck or someone with insider knowledge of how the alarm company would handle the call terry perkinss death terry perkins died in belmarsh prison in february 2018 just days after being ordered to pay 65 million or face an additional seven years he was 69 suffering from severe heart failure kidney disease and bronchopneumonia the day before his death his fitted defibrillator shocked him three times at 345 pm when a nurse tried to examine him that evening he refused because he was watching england play italy in the six nations rugby the official cause was acute cardiac failure but perkins had written extensive notes about alleged failings in prison medical care cancelled appointments improperly administered medications his daughter asked the coroner to investigate no foul play was suggested but the circumstances raise questions did systemic failures in prison healthcare contribute to his death did the psychological stress of the 65 million order play a role brian readers secret death brian reader died on september 16 2023 at age 84 his family kept the death secret for months the death certificate lists his profession as retired gardener a retired gardener not the mastermind of the brinksmat robbery investigation not the orchestrator of britains greatest heist a gardener reader suffered multiple strokes in prison and struggled with health problems after his release in 2018 but his death raises the ultimate question did critical information about the missing millions die with him did he know where all the loot was hidden did he take secrets about basils true background or any insider connections to his grave the films got it wrong three major films have told the hatton garden story and all made significant departures from reality the hatton garden job 2017 invented a fictional handler character and alleged hungarian mafia financiers an entire layer of external financing and organized crime involvement not supported by investigation or court records king of thieves 2018 starred michael caine as reader in a film that softened the gangs behavior presenting them as lovable rogues with charm and redeeming qualities court testimony paints a grimmer picture of men who were ruthless calculating and entirely indifferent to the devastating impact on victims many of whom lost their livelihoods the 2019 itv series hatton garden came closest to accuracy using actual police surveillance transcripts and consulting with retired flying squad chief peter spindler but even this definitive version made editorial choices about what to dramatize and what to omit what all the films underplay is the victim impact small jewellery businesses storing inventory without adequate insurance individuals with family heirlooms and irreplaceable sentimental items businesspeople whose entire livelihoods were in those boxes people who relied on safe deposit services specifically because they didnt trust banks the films romanticize the gang the reality is uglier the lookout who fell asleep one detail perfectly captures the absurdity of this entire operation john kenny collins age 75 was the designated lookout during the heist and during the actual raid security personnel observed him sleeping at his post this is the gang that pulled off britains greatest burglary old men with medical conditions free bus passes and a lookout who couldnt stay awake

teslas sales in china sank to their lowest point last month since october 2022 yicai nov 11 teslas sales in china sank to their lowest point last month since october 2022 according to the latest data industry insiders attributed the disappointing performance to a combination of seasonal factors and growing competition tesla shipped 26000 vehicles in china in october a 357 percent drop from a year ago and a 636 percent dive from the month before according to automotive information platform dangchedi this caused the us electric car startups ranking to fall sharply from seventh place in september to 27th sales of both the model y and model 3 plummeted shipments of the model y plunged 62 percent in october from the month before to 19488 units sliding into 15th place from 2nd place while that of the model 3 sank 68 percent to 6518 autos slipping 94 places down the rankings to the 111th spot the drop in sales might be related to teslas factory holiday schedule and the weeklong national day break sources told yicai in the past three years the austinbased firms sales in october have always been noticeably lower than in september in 2024 there was a 439 percent drop and in 2023 a 342 percent dive new energy vehicle makers are also striving to meet their annual sales targets before the purchase tax breaks expire at the end of the year this has led to stiff competition and squeezed teslas market share industry insiders said teslas share of chinas nev market in terms of sales tumbled to 2 percent in october down from 34 percent a year ago and 55 percent in september according to the latest data from the china passenger car association chinas electric vehicle market continued to grow rapidly last month in october nevs accounted for 572 percent of chinas passenger car sales up 43 percentage points from a year earlier according to cpca data

11th 2025china hatches plan to keep us military from getting its rareearth magnets china hatches plan to keep us military from getting its rareearth magnets china has been building its dominance in rareearth minerals since the 1990s doug kanterbloomberg news china plans to ease the flow of rare earths and other restricted materials to the us by designing a system that will exclude companies with ties to the us military while fasttracking export approvals for other firms according to people familiar with the plan the validated enduser system or veu would enable chinese leader xi jinping to follow through on a pledge to president trump to facilitate the export of such materials while ensuring that they dont end up with us military suppliers a core concern for china according to the people familiar with the plan if strictly implemented the system could make importing certain chinese materials more difficult for automotive and aerospace companies that have both civilian and defense clients beijings plan could still change and its licensing system wouldnt be certain until it is implemented the people said chinas ministry of commerce didnt respond to a request for comment rareearth magnets and other restricted materials are used widely in civilian goods such as electric vehicles and passenger jets but are also needed in jet fighters submarines and attack drones the veu mechanism that beijing is considering is modeled on us laws and procedures as is much of beijings exportcontrol architecture under the american version of the veu system which has been active since 2007 certain chinese companies are cleared to buy sensitive goods under a general authorizationessentially a simplified exportapproval mechanisminstead of needing individual licenses for each purchase this makes it easier to import controlled goods such as chemicals or chipmaking equipment but requires companies to put up with us government inspections of their facilities among other steps to verify compliance with the program since april beijing has used restrictions on the export of powerful rareearth magnets to win concessions from the us in the trade war following the oct 30 truce between trump and xi which saw both sides make concessions china has publicly committed to issuing general licenses to ease the flow of controlled materials while trump has said that the issuance of general licenses by beijing will mark the de facto end of export curbs on critical materials beijing appears to be keeping some of the controls in place even as it tries to ease exports for proven civilian uses beijing hasnt made clear which companies will be eligible for general licenses or exactly what benefits such licenses would provide it isnt clear how long veu protections would last under the us system chinese companies that are cleared to receive purchases under the veu sometimes have this clearance taken away which has caused consternation in beijing as a result many companies may continue to decide to seek out alternative sources of controlled products even if they can benefit from chinas veu arrangement in recent months companies in the us and europe have complained of reduced access to rareearth magnets though china has periodically agreed to relax magnet restrictions chinese rareearth magnet exports to the us declined 29 in september from the month before in a sign that curbs continued to affect companies in the weeks leading up to the truce some morning reads with coffee as we wait for another batch of more core assays more ore nov 11th 2025china hatches plan to keep us military from getting its rareearth magnets china plans validated enduser system to regulate rare earth exports amid us trade tensions econotimes china plans validated enduser system to regulate rare earth exports amid us trade tensions source sgt mikki sprenkle public domain via wikimedia commons china is reportedly preparing new measures to control the flow of rare earth elements and other critical materials to the united states according to a report by the wall street journal the initiative aims to create a validated enduser veu system designed to restrict exports to companies linked to the us military while facilitating shipments to civilian firms this policy move underscores beijings strategic leverage in the global rare earth market where china remains the worlds dominant supplier rare earth elements are vital for producing a wide range of products from smartphones and electric vehicles to advanced military technologies and renewable energy equipment the proposed veu system will enable china to identify and approve buyers that qualify for streamlined imports ensuring faster access for nonmilitary enterprises at the same time it will allow beijing to tighten control over firms with both civilian and defense contractspotentially complicating supply chains for us manufacturers reliant on these materials the decision also aligns with chinese president xi jinpings pledge to us president donald trump to resume rare earth exports to the american market signaling a partial easing of trade restrictions however analysts suggest that the system could serve as a tool for china to maintain influence over critical supply chains while appearing cooperative on the international stage in response washington has intensified efforts to diversify its rare earth sources securing new agreements with allied nations notably australian company lynas rare earths ltd asxlycthe largest rare earth producer outside chinahas become a key player in the us
